blocks.name: cismty
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the class of metric space isometries.

blocks.name: df-ismty
blocks.content: Define a function which takes two metric spaces and returns the set of isometries between the spaces. An isometry is a bijection which preserves distance. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-ismty(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cismty, cmpo(s0, s1, cuni(crn(cxmet)), cuni(crn(cxmet)), cab(s2, wa(wf1o(cv(s2), cdm(cdm(cv(s0))), cdm(cdm(cv(s1)))), wral(s3, cdm(cdm(cv(s0))), wral(s4, cdm(cdm(cv(s0))), wceq(co(cv(s3), cv(s0), cv(s4)), co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cv(s1), cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-ismty(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ Ismty =(s0 ‚àà ‚ãÉ ran(*Met), s1 ‚àà ‚ãÉ ran(*Met)‚Ü¶ { s2 |((s2 : dom(dom(s0))‚Üî dom(dom(s1)))‚àß ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà dom(dom(s0)), ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà dom(dom(s0)),(s3[s0]s4)=((s2 ` s3)[s1](s2 ` s4)))))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
}

blocks.name: ismtyval
blocks.content: The set of isometries between two metric spaces. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.)

blocks.name: ismtybnd
blocks.content: Isometries preserve boundedness. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2014.)

blocks.name: ismtyres
blocks.content: A restriction of an isometry is an isometry. The condition ` A C_ X ` is not necessary but makes the proof easier. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Sep-2015.)
